definition: to speak/to talk/to converse/to chat/to discuss
easy/amiable/to change/to exchange/prefix corresponding to the English adjective suffix "-able" or "-ible"
surname Yi/abbr. for 易經|易经[Yi4 jing1], the Book of Changes

sentences.english: But how easy will it be to get hold of their money?
sentences.chinese: 但是要将富豪的钱财乾坤大挪移过来，谈何容易？

sentences.english: It is hard to please all parties.
However, execept children, it's difficult for adults to eliminate the language barrier?
sentences.chinese: 然而，除了小孩子，成年人欲消除语言障碍谈何容易？

sentences.english: The distance with not feeling well, go home easier said than done.
sentences.chinese: 路途遥远加上身体不适，回家谈何容易。

sentences.english: But how easy is it to rank guest satisfaction among hotels?
sentences.chinese: 不过要把客人对各个酒店的满意度进行排名谈何容易？

sentences.english: This state, furniture Product think one of the circle of fashion, is easier said than done.
sentences.chinese: 这种状态下，家具产品想到时尚圈之一，是谈何容易。

sentences.english: The boss is a stubborn man; it's not easy to make him dance to another tune.
sentences.chinese: 老板是个很倔的人，想让他改变态度谈何容易。

definition: lit. even harder than reaching the sky (idiom)/fig. extremely difficult/far from an easy task
easy as a hand's turn (idiom); very easy/no effort at all
impossible/can't be done/no can do/unable to accomplish
to accomplish the whole task at one stroke (idiom)
pinyin: bi4 qi2 gong1 yu2 yi1 yi4

definition: to rack one's brains for schemes (idiom)/to beat one's brains out
to escape unscathed/to get through in one piece
to be carried away by one's wishful thinking (idiom)/to labor under a delusion/wishful thinking
to suffer untold hardships (idiom); trials and tribulations/with difficulty/after some effort
